intro: Adenocline pauciflora var. transiens, commonly known as the Transient Adenocline, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pale yellow. The plant has slender, hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in mountainous forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
